TopicTitle: Hi. I think I need to quit my job now....:D

Articles.Content:
Hi from the New Mexico desert, not far from "Spaceport America", which of course, is a pallid immitation of the great Kerbal launch complex.

I've managed to get into orbit, strand numerous Kerbals in the vastness of space, and blown up a goodly percentage of the Kerbal GDP.

Now, if I just had more time....

Jim
Welcome Yeah KSP is a easy way to kill many hours of your life, but they are fun huh

OK, now follows a very intimate confession, but I trust you guys:

For me, this is also like a frustration valve. Why frustration, I hear you ask? Because I know in real life the chance getting into space is so small, it will most likely never happen. I'm 31 one now, I lack the skills to travel to space. I can neither fly a plane or dive, I have only a little idea of rocketry, I wear glasses, I'm a bit overweight. As a reference, I compare to Chris Hadfield, his physical condition and his skills.

So KSP offers me the chance to get my portion of space travel before I die. )

Edited June 1, 2013 by NetZer0
Formatting

Managed to "land" on the Mun today. Destroyed my engine, and thereby stranding Jebediah Kerman on the Mun. On the plus side, I was able to successfully EVA from the command module to the lander (*almost* lost Jeb in space doing that). I guess I have to send someone back to the Mun to get Jeb and bring him home now...

Good job on your landing! Jebediaha likes these things. No problem, you can leave him for a month or something

Welcome to the forums anyway
Welcome to the repository of all time wasted on planet earth!
